noun.description: A formal religious or public occasion, typically one celebrating a particular event or anniversary.
examples: the winners were presented with their prizes at a special ceremony

noun.description: The ritual observances and procedures performed at grand and formal occasions.
examples: the new Queen was proclaimed with due ceremony

phrases: we don't stand on ceremony in this house
They don't stand on ceremony at Central Park of a Saturday when it's time for the stock-car racing to begin.
He was never someone to stand on ceremony or circumstance even if this was his last domestic game of rugby.
I've found that sometimes it doesn't pay to stand on ceremony.
The students treat Hawking with playful irreverence; there is no standing on ceremony or elitism here.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French ceremonie or Latin caerimonia religious worship, (plural) ritual observances.
